style: Woven: Early Near East, Byzantine & Spain
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 34.9 x 17.8 cm (13 3/4 in. x 7 in.)
title: Textile
provenance:
Before 1902, Francisco Miquel y Badia collection. 
1902, purchased by John Pierpont Morgan and given to the Hewitt sisters.
medium:
Medium: silk, gilded parchment wound around silk core
Technique: slit tapestry weave with eccentric weft
description: One full and most of a second roundel surrounded by  interlaced bands forming star and rosette motifs.  In the upper roundel, two confronted figures toast each other with cups raised;  in the lower roundel the figure on the right raises a cup and the other figure a long-necked bottle.
name: Textile
